children.subject: Its only for L&S. Its called Degree Check on Calcentral.
How were you able to reach this page? I'm interested in my degree progress as well.

history.content: I think it'd be best to contact your adviser. The Calcentral degree check tool is known to be inaccurate as it does not incorporate every detail for every degree.

As widely emailed when the Academic Progress Report was released, it is not reliable to check major requirements (silly, we know). This is done by hand when you graduate. You, our website, and the Berkeley Academic Guide are correct, the two courses you choose do need to be taken for a letter grade. Thanks for checking!

I am a student admitted prior to Fall 2017, which means I need to pick 3 courses out of ee16a, ee16b, and math 54. I took Math 54 for a grade and 16B for fun, P/NP. I believed that this was not sufficient to fulfill the requirement, according to @3578 , so I enrolled in EE16A for a letter grade this upcoming semester.

However, Calcentral's degree check says in my lower division requirements section that taking EE16B P/NP fulfilled the requirement. This is very confusing to me. I thought all lower div requirements needed to be for a letter grade? How can I verify whether I actually filled these requirements? The degree checklist on the eecs.berkeley.edu checklist doesn't clarify this, and I have not been able to find any posts on Piazza about this.
history.subject: EE16A/B requirement for LSCS needs to be for a letter grade, but CalCentral indicates otherwise?
